text:
Hi Erich, There we go! However you had a typo: "If the value of SCAPackageLevel
is 1, the installed application is Acrobat Reader. If the value of
SCAPackageLevel is greater than 1, the installed application is Acrobat." I
checked two and got values of 1 and 3 as expected. I suppose, "1" and "not 1"
should suffice for a quick check, at least until they define "less than 1." I've
searched a few times, of course, and haven't found that doc so thanks. Already
thought of a problem case... What if two people share a PC and one has a
subscription? The key here is HKLM... ---- Steve Yates ITS, Inc. -----Original
Message-----
Link: None

metadata.topic: RE: Detecting whether PC has Acrobat or Reader
metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] RE: Detecting whether PC has Acrobat or Reader
